definitions.text: abnormal alignment of one or both eyes
the act of squinting; looking with the eyes partly closed
cross one's eyes as if in strabismus
examples: The children squinted so as to scare each other

definitions.text: be cross-eyed; have a squint or strabismus
partly close one's eyes, as when hit by direct blinding light
examples: The driver squinted as the sun hit his windshield

definitions.text: (used especially of glances) directed to one side with or as if with doubt or suspicion or envy; - Elizabeth Bowen
examples: her eyes with their misted askance look
